intro: Medinilla anamalaiana, commonly known as the Anamala mountain medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually pink or red, with a distinctive tubular shape. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
